title: Turkey, Bacon and Brie Panini with Apricot Aioli

instructions.1: Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Spray 15x10x1-inch pan with CRISCO® Original No-Stick Cooking Spray. Unroll pizza crust dough in pan; press dough to edges of pan. Bake 7 to 12 minutes or until light golden brown. Cool 5 minutes.
instructions.2: Meanwhile, in 10-inch skillet, cook bacon over medium heat, turning once, until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet; drain on paper towels.
instructions.3: In small bowl, make apricot aioli by stirring mayonnaise and preserves until well mixed. Set aside.
instructions.4: Cut pizza crust in half crosswise to make 2 rectangles. Remove rectangles from pan; spread half of the apricot aioli evenly over each rectangle. Top 1 rectangle evenly with turkey, bacon and cheese. Add other rectangle, aioli side down. Cut large sandwich in half crosswise; cut each in half diagonally to make 4 sandwiches.
instructions.5: Heat 12-inch skillet over medium heat until hot. Place 2 sandwiches in skillet. Place smaller skillet or saucepan on sandwiches to flatten slightly; keep skillet on sandwiches while cooking. Cook 1 to 4 minutes on each side or until cheese is melted and bread is golden brown. Remove from skillet; cover with foil to keep warm. Repeat with remaining 2 sandwiches. Garnish with parsley sprigs.

questions.question: In Step 5, is the cheese from Step 4 being used?
Is cheese from Step 4 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is other rectangle from Step 4 still available in Step 5?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 1?
If we skip Step 4, is it still valid to melt the cheese in Step 5?
Can we cook (Step 2) and cut (Step 4) at the same time?
